title: [K-12] Gamification-Based Strategies for Improving Mathematics Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and experience using online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, emphasizing math concepts applicable to daily life due to the characteristics of job-seeking learners

learning_goals: Learners can improve accuracy in solving basic math problems by 30% through online activities embedded with gamification elements (competition, rewards).
Learners can evaluate their own learning processes using metacognitive strategies in game-based learning environments and propose at least two improvement strategies.
Learners achieve an average accuracy rate of over 80% in quiz activities with competitive elements and enhance their ability to utilize peer feedback during collaborative learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
